Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: KMSecrist
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location to Victoria station. Negatives: breakfast was a joke - tiny area, served toast and cereal, couldn't even eat the last morning I was there because there was no room in the breakfast area, bathroom was cramped and almost put in as an after thought (it was like a cruise ship bathroom), drain didn't work properly and I nearly flooded the bathroom, told management and they "fixed" it, it was 100 better but it wasn't nearly as bad as before. room just had a nasty feeling to it. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to leave positive feedback but can't”
Reviews.Author: HarshButFair51
Reviews.Content: I had tried to book a room here at the last minute using a booking website but they didn't get back to me in time to confirm the booking. However, a double en-suite room was on offer for £55. Not having heard from them, I decided to walk down to the hotel (10 minutes from work) and enquire about a room directly. The young man on reception was polite and helpful but explained that they had only room available, a single without facilities. In fairness to him he let me see it before I paid. The room was at the very top of the hotel, was tiny and the nearest toilet/shower facilities were on the floor below. It was clean though and adequate for my needs but the price was still £55! Sadly, what he failed to tell me was that all the water tanks for the hotel were located in the ceiling void above the room. Consequently, every time someone took a shower, flushed a toilet, washed their hands, filled a kettle, my room was invaded by the sounds of water gurgling, tanks filling, etc. It didn't make for good night's sleep and at 4:30 I gave up and left the hotel before 6, foregoing breakfast and deciding to take a shower at work. As I left, the same young man was on reception and even though I got a terse 'good morning' from him, he didn't look up and meet my eye. I also noticed that the vacancies sign was still showing from the previous evening so I suspect he MAY have been a little economical with the truth about my room being the only one available. All in all, I suspect that had I been given a different room and managed a good night's sleep, I would be leaving rather different feedback. It is probably, a fairly decent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: DanielVinkelman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights back in September. The staff was very friendly. The guy working the night shift printed my flight tickets. There is an Internet cafe around the corner, but still, that was very nice of him. Place is small, but clean, in a great location. 5 min walk to the train/bus depot. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Polo_and_Marco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night during the week. Check-in was quick and easy. We had booked the room on the hotel's webpage and after the receptionist checked the register we were handed the key to the room. We had a double room which was small but clean. There was tea and coffee making facilities in the room along with a small flatscreen TV. The room has an ensuite bathroom which is a tiny wet room with shower, toilet and sink. The bathroom was clean but metal fixtures were beginning to rust. The bed was reasonably comfortable but shorter and narrower than standard british double bed size. Reception is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Its a B&B names as a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayur L
Reviews.Content: Hi, I booked the hotel based on the pictures on various website including their own website. When i went there we were totally disappointed. The room was very very small, bed squeaking, bathroom smaller then my ward-robe. If they had advertised as a B&B it would have made sense but i would not have paid the GBP 75 as I was getting B&B for much cheaper price. Even the BF was not great and dint have options... The only good thing about the place was a very good customer service and the location. The staff in the front desk was very friendly and helpful. It must be good for budget traveller (though its is pricee)

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROgalati
Reviews.Content: I stayed to this hotel 2 times: 28-30 June 2002 and 09-11 December 2011. This is a budget hotel, close to Victoria Station (3 minutes walk) and close to many atraction in London. The breakfast is poor and the room a very small. Fist time I hadn't WC in my room, second time I had toilet in my room. The room are basic and clean. For the price payed for this hotel, in another capital of Europe I payed for 4 of 5 stars hotel. In my country, Romania, The Dover Hotel can be like a hotel with 1 or 2 stars. For London, this hotel have a good price for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Economy and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Red_RobboPaulhan
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with the comfort of the room and the en suite facilities. The decoration and the furniture was not recent but both produced a feeling that was pleasant and accommodating. The hotel is well served with late-night corner shops, pubs and restaurants in the proximity and the shopping centre at Victoria station is two minutes walk .There was a reasonable choice of TV programmes and the toast for breakfast was freshly prepared. Definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, the room is very small and bathroom really compact. It is generally clean but the place could do with freshen up, the bathroom smell quite bad because it so small. It is a very basic hotel. The fire security system was puzzling because I had the receptionist guy knocking on my door on the second evening asking whether I was smoking and if everything was alright. He apparently had a signal alert down the reception of smoke or something, while you won't hear any alarm in your own room. It's a concern. He was knocking all the doors asking the same questions. The only thing is good about it is the location very handy for the tubes and trains, only 2 mins away. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: ab s
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for 3 nights and were not very impressed. you have to leave your room key with the front desk when you leave the hotel for the day. they advertise free wi-fi, but only the unsecured websites are included, if you want to check your email or flights etc you have to pay for a secure log in. contenetal breakfast is a stretch...they provide you with yoghurt, juice, coffee and tea, there are ladies in the basement that tell you to help your self,... meaning pick a table with the warm yogurt already set out for you...get your own juice and cereal....then they make you 3pcs of toast per table. the rooms are very dated, and in need of a fresh coat of paint. the ensuite bathroom in our room was obviously added in long after the building was built. poor excuse for a bathroom....thing "camper" bathroom. during our last day in london a bunch of stuff was taken from our room....people across the hall saw two men enter our room and the room beside with keys. It was after we confronted the men at the front desk about our missing items that they informed us that they have individual safe's that guest are to use,...and they do not cover any stolen items taken from the rooms. we were not the only ones to have stuff taken from our rooms either.....and apparently this was not a first occurance at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money & location for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterShoe
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here on New Years Eve 2010, we arrives at 10oclock but checkin wasn't until 2oclock, they let us keep our case at the hotel until later on. It is a very basic hotel, the bathroom was like out of a caravan it was very small luckily we didn't need to use the shower. But for new years eve all you need a room is for a bed to sleep in. So for that sole use it was good. We didn't have the breakfast so cannot comment on it. The location is really good, it is literally a 3 minute walk to Victoria Station. Most tubes go through the Victoria line which is an added bonus. I wouldnt recommend staying at this hotel for longer than one night, but it definitely a good value for money as it only costed us Â£85 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Budget[ except in price]”
Reviews.Author: Roy H
Reviews.Content: Good location near Victoria Coach& Train Station. Room clean but very cramped and poorly maintained. Washbasin in bedroom, but shower and toilet in separate room down two steps. Cistern lid not fixed on toilet, shower curtain not adequate and both rooms very badly and cheaply decorated. Breakfast described as continental but was only cereal, toast and yoghurt. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option in expensive London!”
Reviews.Author: Betilu
Reviews.Content: To begin with, let's keep one thing in mind, before rating the hotel: London is an expensive city! Dover hotel is a good option if you are on a budget. It is centrally located, near Victoria Station (good for services to and from Gatwick and Heathrow), there are supermarkets and restaurants nearby as well as nice pubs and restaurants. The hotel is basic. It is true that rooms are small, but not tiny. The bathroon is tiny, indeed! It had some plumbing problems but that is usual in London. The staff is helpful and polite. The women in charge of breakfast are great! They are warm and make you feel welcome. As for breakfast, it is good, including coffee, tea, milk, cereals, marmelade, jam, butter, juice and freshly made toast. Simple but tasty! There are coffee/tea making facilities in the room, which is great! Internet is free only if you want to browse something. However, if you need to use your mail, a booking engine or something of the sort you have to pay for using it. Flatscreen tv. No toiletries supplied but soap. A very good budget option in amazing London! Thank you for everything. Hope to see you very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value considering location”
Reviews.Author: Brini_and_Paul
Reviews.Content: We were on the top floor, so we had a decent sized room. The member of staff who we spoke to was very helpful. We had already booked ourselves into another hotel around the corner, but seeing as that hotel was not as expected, we decided to try our luck here at the Dover, and we were very pleasantly surprised. We explained our situation to the member of staff on reception, and he gave us the keys of 2 different rooms so that we could view them before we collected our bags from the other hotel. The Dover was very clean and welcoming, and would have all you need for a weekend break or sight-seeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “clean and decent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: drumsman
Reviews.Content: stayed one night in july 2011,and paid Â£120 for double room ,very clean and comfortable,help yourselve to some basic breakfast stuff,good tv and bed,would go back,nice area round pimlico victoria.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite”
Reviews.Author: chadh20
Reviews.Content: Me and my aunt stayed in this hotel in December 2008, we were very pleased with this hotel. We visited many cities in Europe, all of which had larger rooms and where rated with higher stars but this one was still one of my favorites. We stayed in a room on the first floor straight down the hall from the entrance. We never had a problem with getting luggage to the room as it was no problem to leave it in the front office and come back to get the rest. Staff seemed to be nice. Breakfast was also fine- (Coffee, Hot Chocolate, Juices, Milk, Cereal, Toast...) Also Close walk to Victoria station, Busses etc. Nearby Convenience store on the corner. Good/Nice area. This isn't a luxury hotel but it felt very homely to me.. I felt like I could walk out of my room and in a few steps be out on the street. I could step out front to use my laptop or stand at the door to get some fresh air (Although I dont recommend stepping out often in Winter, as it's very cold!!) and never had to feel that the Management would say anything to me or etc. If you feel like you could use the saved money elsewhere, I'd choose The Dover. I have no complaints about this hotel. As I tell most people "The hotel I stayed in in London was the smallest, and least stars but it was my favorite" I would more than likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unattentive, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: anygav
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel based on location, i.e. close to my exam venue. After checking in, I kindly asked to help me get my suitcase to my room which was on the first floor. The receptionist, Mr. Kassam refused to help stating it is not a 5 star hotel and they don't have porters. While taking my suitcases upstairs I injured my arm. I was in a lot of pain, couldn't sleep very well and I had a 3 hour written exam the next morning. After the exam I returned to the hotel to collect my bags and wanted to let the management know what had happened and that I will be writing a review online. The same receptionist stated that he was the management. I then requested to speak to someone higher than Mr. Kassam. Mr. Kassam dialled a number and spoke to someone in a foreign language and then put the phone down without letting me speak to that person. He said his boss is busy and will call back. It was very clear that staff and their management didn't care about what I had to say and didn't give a damn about my injury. Very disappointing. The room also wasn't up to a standard, very dirty with dust everywhere which made me sneez a lot. Breakfast is not continental, it's just a pot of yoghurt, toast, juice and cereal, which is plenty for me but I expect other guests might not be so happy. Overall experience is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS WHERE YOU STAY WHEN THERE IS NOWHERE ELSE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: wayne_mmkt
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively throughout the UK and Europe on business and this is by far the worst hotel I have been in for a business traveler. If you are backpacking through Europe on a budget and want shelter and a light meal for breakfast then this is the place for you. If you are on business and want a cheerful room with a good nights sleep and a solid breakfast before a day of meetings then find somewhere else for sure. Details: - Nice location - Dingy check in - Dirty, old drafty room that you would think was rented hourly - Uncomfortable bed - The toilet and shower made me feel like I was in a camper (caravan) - Soap on the bed made me wonder if they reuse it - Window would not close tight so it was cold and drafty - Breakfast could hardly be called breakfast - Thin walls so you hear everything next door... everything. Spend a few more pounds and stay somewhere else. Ignore the positive reviews as they must be from the management. I cant imagine there being people who would stay here more than once in a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, basic at a good price”
Reviews.Author: cpeaston
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed for two nights. The room was clean and had everything we needed. It was not the biggest room in the world but not the smallest I have stayed in when visiting London either. The hotel is 5 mins walk from Victoria rail, tube and coach station. Basic room for a good price would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellen value with great service”
Reviews.Author: Ffinnant
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel. Ideally located for all London sights. Reception manned 24 hours with friendly, helpful staff. Highly recommended for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “So happy with our choice of hotel, relieved actually!”
Reviews.Author: JanJolly
Reviews.Content: When you book a 2* hotel room for 4 people in London it is a bit of a worry. We expected that we'd be like sardines in a tin, but on arrival were pleasantly surprised. We were given a basement floor room, which had windows and a door, so plenty of light. The room was U shaped with 3 single beds and a double. There was plenty of space for 4 of us ladies to get ready. The room was nearly spotless, neat and tidy. Breakfast was basic, but good for what we wanted, cereal and plenty of warm toast, tea, coffee and delicious hot chocolate! The hotel was a 6 or 8 minute walk from Victoria train and bus stations, so very easy to travel from there around London. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The area was nice and quiet. I can thorouly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very small but staff more than helpfull and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dangod
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my teenage daughter. Bedroom small but clean and tidy. Shower room extremely compact and I think anyone who is fairly tall would be struggling. The staff were all friendly and helpful when asked anything. The breakfast room seemed clean and bright and the breakfast was basic but served by friendly staff. My only complaint would be that our bedroom was next to the staff toilet which was a bit noisy when they used it overnight. The Hotel is 5 mins walk from Victoria bus and coach station and was extremely handy for the the Victorian Appollo Theatre were we saw Wicked. All in all we had a good stay and I would stay again as it was cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: AnneofStPaul
Reviews.Content: My twenty-year-old daughter and I stayed here. It was going to be two nights but alas, even though I told the man at the front desk we'd be staying another night they moved us out while we were out all day sightseeing.. Imagine my surprise when we returned late (after the theatre) and found all our stuff had been removed. We went across the street, paid the same price as the Dover, got a better breakfast next morning and left happy. I worked in the travel industry for twenty years and nothing ever happened to me like that before.

Reviews.Title: “Better Around”
Reviews.Author: BillWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my wife on a theatre trip. The room was small and no toiletries supplied. The bathroom was only a shower and small as well. The breakfast room (basically in the basement) was too small for the number of guests and people arriving for breakfast had nowhere to sit. Biggest gripe: They advertise "Continental Breakfast", but cereal, fruit juice and toast is not what I class as a Continental Breakfast. In general, nearly all the patrons looked disappointed at what was offered for breakfast. You'll get more value for your money (and only a little more) at another hotel...

Reviews.Title: “good location, good character, good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelLite001
Reviews.Content: The Dover Hotel is in a very convenient location; it's on a quiet street but is only a short walk (<5 minutes) from the hustle and bustle of Victoria Station. The staff are efficient and friendly. If you like value for your money and a little character then this is a good place to stay. Nothing fancy, no lifts/elevator so it's a walk up to all the room (we had room 16 on the top floor), and very small but workable bedrooms and bathrooms. wireless internet worked well as did the TV with a range of English channels. Continental breakfast was simple but tasty. Only issue was that the night was hot and the room didn't have a fan. I learned the next morning that fans were available if we had called downstairs and asked but we didn't know. Also be aware that most of the local restaurants close at 11:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, nice staff, nicely situated, but small and unhygienic”
Reviews.Author: Reviewerjoe
Reviews.Content: If you stay for a short while and you don't mind hygiene, the Dover Hotel is quite o.k. The room is small, with heavy akward placed doors (they slam shut). The beds are on wheels, very stuffed (hard) and de cover cloths (beneath the sheets) are unbelievable dirty / stained. Very unpleasant to discover when you leave. It smells stuffy, but we had a window to open (not much of a view though; blind wall). The bathroom isn't very ventilated as well. Everything, except for the flatscreen tv, seems a bit old. For example, the soap you get, looks used. You can make some tea (or freeze-dried coffee), but the waterboiler stands on a very small plastic shelf. That's not much of a problem though, if you're carefull enough. More annoying was the constant buzz from machinery somewhere in the hotel and the tiny breakfast you get (one and a half toast with jam). Nevertheless, the staff is nice and 24hrs a day available. You can't lock the door of your room from the outside, but without a key you can't open it either and there are lockers at the desk you can use for free. Furthermore, the location is good: you can get to the Victoria Station in about ten minutes and the neighbourhoood is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Quite okay”
Reviews.Author: hermit1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok for us, even though the rooms were a bit small, and so was the bathroom, but everything was fine and working, the shower was great, hot water all the time (unlike some other hotel we stayed in), and it was a lot cleaner too...it was okay, it could've been better, but all in all it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Out to get your money”
Reviews.Author: Spainyoli
Reviews.Content: I was shocked that they had charged me before even seeing the room. When I saw the room it was not what I asked for, instead of twin beds we were given a double bed saying there were no more twins available and refusing to offer a solution. Another Italian group had a similar peoblem and were given a twin room instead of a double we eventually swapped on our own accord as the hotel staff did not assist in any way. Breakfast was poor. The only good thing was the central location but there are better and cheaper BB's in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but small”
Reviews.Author: J2424
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and the shower/bathroom are a little bit larger than a port-a-potty. This didn't really bother us as we were only there to sleep and shower. It served it's purpose. It is very conveniently located near the Victoria station which can get you anywhere and about a mile from Westminster. Breakfast was enough for me. Cereal, a coffee machine, juice, and freshly made toast brought to your table. Held me over until lunch. Stay here if you are young and want to save money. Our double bed was small, but we were so tired we didn't mind. Some noise with loud slamming doors and creeking floor above, but happened only a few times in our three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and cheap”
Reviews.Author: FlorianKunz
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very small rooms, but the price is very good. You get a nice breakfast. The hotel is close to Vicoria Station so you can easily get around.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the nightmanager for setting off the fire alarm @ 2am with garlic bread”
Reviews.Author: Bigworld1984
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, and only 5 min walk from Victoria station, for a 2* hotel, you get what you pay for. Rooms are small but adequate. Bathroom is tiny and only has a shower, no bath. The room is reasonably clean, could do with a vacuum under the bed. The worst things about our stay was the double bed was sheeted with one single bed sheet, so half way through the night, you end up sleeping on a bobbled mattress. The hotel is linked to another hotel next door, Our room was in the basement, this wasn't an issue until @ 2am when the night manager set off the fire alarm because he burnt some garlic bread, the kitchen (which linked between the two hotels) was 2 doors away from our room, so our room filled with smoke and it lingered in the hall for a couple of hours, until the manager sprayed enough air freshener to gas out a small country. Not alot of sleep that night ! The next night I was kept awake with noisy plumbing. Breakfast was basic but what you expect for the money- selection of 4 cereals and a slice of toast, coffee from a machine.

Reviews.Title: “Non ha deluso le nostre aspettative”
Reviews.Author: nikicp
Reviews.Content: December 2009 Christmas, couple with children, satisfied. I congratulate the staff for the service, availability sympathy and fairness. the Dover Hotel London is exactly as I had appeared on the Internet, these same rooms furnished in line with the same types of choices of Victoria, small spaces and rooms basic but clean. The room was cleaned daily as well as sheets. Breakfast simple roasted coffee milk distributors, European, I expected more, scarce. The staff has proven to be sympathetic and helpful when I decided to start a day before the free luggage storage. Speak only English but used to tolerate those who speak badly as me, I recommend you return. Family 3, from Taranto.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to rest your head after a busy day in London!”
Reviews.Author: Em85Sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dover Hotel for 9 nights in January 2009. My brother and I shared a twin room one floor up from the reception area. The hotel staff were pleasant on arrival and each day when we left our key with them. There is no elevator in the hotel and we were lucky that we did not have to take our luggage up too many flights of stairs. The room was adequate for the price and is the size of many hotel rooms in London. The room and bathroom were clean and tidied each day. The room had twin beds, a rack for hanging clothes, a basin, table, kettle, heater and tv. After experiencing a very cold night we asked staff for extra blankets on our way out one morning and found them on our beds when we returned. The free breakfast of toast, cereal and juice was the perfect way to start the day. The hotel is in an ideal location - close to Victoria station - to access all the sights of London, either by walking or taking the tube. With all that there is to do in London, a hotel need only be a place to rest. This hotel does just that! When I return to London I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room!”
Reviews.Author: blackswanMalaysia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is very near to the Victoria station just 10 minutes walk. The room is basic and clean. Breakfast is just toast and cereal. There is no lift so be prepared to drag your luggage up the stairs. Overall is a good budget hotel and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel with no frills”
Reviews.Author: Tennisfan1Selby
Reviews.Content: 7 Tennis fans travelled to London and wanted to stay in a budget hotel that was cheap and cheerful and most importantly - clean! Well it was cheap, not so cheerful and it was clean. The rooms were en suite (v basic but ok). Bedding was clean and rooms an ok size. The breakfast was basic but kind of what you expect for Â£25pp. The hotel is handy for the tube but that's about it..it's a good half hour by taxi to the centre of London (1 hour to the 02 arena). We'd recommend it for a 1 night stay in London for anyone not that bothered about having sausages, bacon and hash browns for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kitkatsky
Reviews.Content: I was meeting an old friend whom I hadn't seen for years in London and decided to travel up the night before and stay over so I would be fresh for our catch up the following day. I was very much travelling on a budget and after doing a fair bit of research, found the Dover Hotel online and booked at their non refundable advance rate of Â£50 for a double en suite room for sole occupancy. The hotel was very centrally located just around the corner from the bus and train station and had a 24 hour reception. It was extremely clean and comfortable though very basic. It was exactly what I wanted but I would not recommend for anyone looking for luxury accommodation. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny but it was exactly what I needed and I will be using it again the next time I go to London. The only suggestions I would have for improvements would be to provide bigger bath towels and for the staff to respond to emails. While I was there, all the staff I met were absolutely lovely but I was a bit annoyed that prior to arrival I had sent two emails with queries about the area and facilities and both were ignored. I work in a budget hotel in Bristol myself and I think in our type of establishment, customer service needs to go above and beyond. I would certainly be having words with any of my staff who ignored emails. However, I really don't want to end on a negative since I had such a lovely stay there. Would definitely recommend to any travellers on a budget or women travelling alone who want to stay in a place where they will immediately feel safe and looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: peterrg
Reviews.Content: We stopped there for one night as we needed a budget hotel around the Pimlico area. We paid Â£55 through last minute but you can get it down to about Â£50 if you book direct. We did not expect a lot as we knew it was a budget hotel so went fully warned after reading some of the reviews. The room we stayed in was small - a double bed with a small double wardrobe, a dressing table, small bedside table & about a 17"LCD TV mounted on the wall. The bathroom was very small with the shower enclosure just having a curtain around it and a tiny basin with toilet also in the room. The main thing I look for in a hotel is for the rooms & bathroom to be clean and the Dover Hotel did not disappoint me as I could not complain about the cleanliness. Breakfast in the morning consisted of cereals, toast, juice and tea/coffee. Again we knew this as we read reviews but you could have as much cereals you wanted and can always ask for more toast! The service we had was very good and the staff were always polite. The location is also excellent as it is only 5 minutes or so from Victoria tube station. Would I stay there again? If I was after a budget hotel I would certainly give it strong consideration. I think the price we paid was about right and there would be no way I would pay the rack rate of about Â£95. If you want a budget hotel that is clean with a decent level of service then you won't go far wrong but expect small rooms and limited breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGRMY
Reviews.Content: Rooms were more than decent for the price we paid as they were on average bigger than the usual cramped spaces offered by similar hotels in the same area. Reception was helpful when needed. The location is good too as the hotel is just a 13 min walk from the underground. It is also near Sainsbury and some decent restaurants. The only negatives are that there are no lifts and the toom decorations seem to be from two generations ago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glos_UKJoefish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dover Hotel for two nights. The staff were kind and helpful. The location is excellent, only 5-10 minutes walk from the Victoria Coach and Train Stations. The breakfast was simple which included toast, cereals, juices and coffee/tea and for the price we paid this was excellent. The rooms are a little dated and small, but they were clean and tidy. The bathroom was very small with a shower. We would stay at this hotel again, but only for a short stay. i.e. 2-4 nights. It is a good budget hotel and an ideal place to stay if you wish to explore London.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CandisAshley
Reviews.Content: Location: Very close to Victoria Station, short walk to streets with restaurants and stores. Convenience store right around the corner which is convenient. Rooms: We were very surprised at how small the room was. Double bed with a nightstand squeezed in, barely any room to walk anywhere once we had our two bags on the floor. A few hangers provided, kettle and tea provided, no air conditioning in our room, small window with no screen, flat screen tv and free internet. We had no toilet in our room, it was just a shared bathroom on the top floor. The room did have a sink and small shower, but because it was such a small space, it wasn't comfortable to move around other than sleep. There were probably larger rooms in the hotel, but the room we were in would maybe be better suited for a single traveller. Service: The staff at the front desk were very friendly. Breakfast was served in the basement, dining room was very small. The breakfast included juice, coffee, cereal and toast, which was somehow cold by the time it was served, even though the kitchen was right beside the dining room. Overall, while the service and location were good, we wouldn't stay here again, as it felt more like a hostel than a hotel, and the price didn't suit the room we were given.

Reviews.Title: “A 16th birthday treat for my daughter”
Reviews.Author: DidoLondonderry
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my daughter to London for a theatre break for her 16th birthday. I didn't go for the usual 'show and hotel' package, instead booked everything separately as I had limited funds. I booked the Dover Hotel in Belgrave Road, Victoria after reading reviews on TA. I had already booked 2 cheap flights with Ryanair (Â£28 rtn) so we were good to go. We stayed for 3 days - Monday to Wednesday (29 June - 1st July) and crammed a lot in! The hotel was as described in TA - basic but clean and that's all I wanted really. We spent very little time in it as we were out all day sightseeing as my daughter had never been before. The owners were very friendly and helped us with directions. At breakfast the women serving were also very nice. Breakfast was - again - basic but what you would have at home, fruit juice, cereals, tea/coffee and toast. Near the hotel was Victoria Shopping Mall which has a food court on the upper floor so if we were hungry there was plenty of choice nearby. On the Monday after checking in to the hotel, we decided to have a look around. We went to a couple of ticket booths to price tickets for 'Wicked' and ended up getting two for the stalls for the Tuesday evening performance at the brilliant price of Â£32.50 each - 4 rows from the front! We then just wandered round the capital - from Buckingham Palace, through Green Park and up to Fortnum and Mason's and Piccadilly Circus. We had our dinner at TGi Fridays where they sang Happy Birthday to my daughter and presented her with a huge slice of hot chocolate fudge cake with a candle in it - she looked embarrassed but I think she really enjoyed it! On the Tuesday we decided we would go for a bus tour with the Big Bus Company - well worth it for anyone who really wants to see the capital - but opt for the blue tour with the headphones as it goes out round Kensington, whereas the red tour doesn't appear to do that (according to the map). As you can hop on and off, we were able to spend more time at particular places - e.g Trafalgar Square, etc. Tuesday night was spent in the Apollo Theatre - the show was amazing! On Wednesday, we went to Covent Garden where there was a real mix of performers. Bearing in mind that this was one of the hottest days so far this year they all were brilliant and their shows were definitely worth seeing! All in all we had a great time shopping and sightseeing. We came home exhausted but happy and apparently this was her best birthday ever! Proof that the capital doesn't have to cost an arm and a leg to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: kissum
Reviews.Content: We just left this morning, and had a very pleasant stay. It is definitely budget accommodation- the beds are older, there are some holes where appliances have been moved, and it's very tiny. You could shower sitting on the toilet. But it's a great price and location in central London, clean and safe. And the service was excellent, everyone was very friendly and helpful. I'd stay again! Also, be aware that Belgrave Road is bit noisy at night- bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: squizzly
Reviews.Content: The price, the location, the staff, the rooms - all of it absolutely perfect. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “A gem for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Littlewytch
Reviews.Content: My mother and I having left the Tudor Inn hotel as it was too dirty to stay in, brought our bags down the street and began our search for alternative accommodation. Our first stop was the Dover Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpfull, allowing us to view the room before deciding. The room was small but spotless. The shower room also tiny, but again spotless with clean towels supplied. The room had been cleaned and aired.. Breakfast was plain, but the staff were very friendly and there was plenty of food to set you up for the day. The staff gave directions to Victoria station and offered any other tourist information we may need. They were courteous and helpfull. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to tour London on a budget. Clean, friendly and cheap hotel near all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money at the Dover hotel London”
Reviews.Author: CorinneS
Reviews.Content: Hi, Just spent one night at the dover hotel in a family room . Excellent value for money. The room cost as little as Â£100 for 5 people. Breakfast was toast, cereal,fruit juice and hot drinks. The room was very clean and tidy. The staff were extremely pleasent and helpfull. Our room was in the basement so lacked view , but for Â£20 each you cannot complain whatsoever. If all you want is a cheap place to sleep, that is in central London, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. It is located 5 mins walk from Victoria station/ underground, perfect for sight seeing. Also the Garrick Theatre is located here. Will definetly stay here again and recommend to friends and family. Miss Silcock

Reviews.Title: “LOOK NO FURTHER - Australians This is it”
Reviews.Author: sixteendays
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a " 4 star" hotel(will not name) near Victoria Station- it was a dump with a high price tag (organised by our agent) - We organised Dover weeks prior to leaving Australia without seeing, communication was excellent and reassuring. The Dover was : *Clean light airy *Staff professional ,helpful ,courteous,knowledgeable and accessible for any enquiry. *Location ,quiet and could not ask for better as only a 4 minute walk from Victoria Station. *Food/Dining room as much as you wanted and fresh *Hot and cold running water perfect *Wakeup call and messages collected *Larger bus companies DO pick up from there. *Internet available when required. *Budget on price but not on experience. Will return when able and will refer to anyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Priced for What It Has to Offer”
Reviews.Author: DissapointedUsa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly on their website after its recommendation on a touristic guide we bought for our trip. We checked the reviews and thought it was a good option, however the experience was not that good. The people at the front desk were nice and at least our room was clean (other guests were not very happy though), but the room was amazingly tiny and uncomfortable. The bed was very narrow, we booked a double bed but I think this one was not a normal double bed. Needless to say we didn't get much sleep there. We had a bathroom in our room, which was nice, but again, it was amazingly tiny. Breakfast was acceptable although not very abundant. Finally, the location was not that good, nothing that interesting around the area. If the location is important I would suggest to look into the 10+ other hotel options along the same road (Belgrave Road), they seemed to be nicer. For the most part we felt that this hotel is much over-priced for what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of London, but not so good...”
Reviews.Author: BrasiliaBrasil
Reviews.Content: Hi, I've been to Dover Hotel in August. The location is excellent, if you like to walk, in a few minutes you can get to the basic attractions (Parliament, London Eye, etc). The staff is kind. The accomodations are not so good. The hotel is very old, the carpet and courtains terrible if you have alergy. The rooms are very narrow. The numbem 4 doesn't have ventilation. The bathroom, if you can call it so, is horrible. It is difficult even to take a shower. Don't trust the photos in the site, it's not even close to you are going to find. Comming back to London I'd rather pay a litte more and stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Short On Room-I-Ness ... High On Price!”
Reviews.Author: Bike-a-Rue
Reviews.Content: On my most recent visit to London, I stayed at the Dover Hotel near Victoria Station ... its' location was in a quieter area of the city. The double room I occupied was confined and limited in space with adequate lighting. The small size of the room didn't justify the hotel room rate charged to yours truly. I also had an issue with the morning breakfast service. No smiles or "good morning" wishes were you greeted with! Looking at making a change in this area would most certainly brighten up the morning mood. I will not be returning to the Dover Hotel when in London next and would recommend that you consider staying elsewhere. Your hotel choices are unlimited and in many cases much more affordable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Theft was the last straw”
Reviews.Author: rickpow
Reviews.Content: Although the room was clean and the staff was cordial, I cannot say anything else positive about our experience. The room was the smallest I've ever experienced. It was on the 4th floor and there was no lift, nor was any help offered carrying our luggage up. I could feel the individual springs through the old mattress. The lack of air conditioning required that the window be left open to the busy, noisy street below. Breakfast was nothing special, offering only toast or dry cereal along with juice/coffee. All this would have been tolerable, but then my new MP3 player was stolen by someone at the hotel who had access to our room. The staff provided no concession and barely an apology for this theft, so that was the last straw. I would strongly recommend avoiding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! A Rat Hole!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danfransmom
Reviews.Content: Shame on you Expedia for allowing customers to book a room through you. This place was horrible! I thought that all I really needed was a clean room, warm bed and a place to shower, the Dover Hotle...uh....Hostel...was not it. How it received 2 stars is beyond me. The room was filthy, ripped curtains, water spots where the ceiling had leaked, mold growing in the toilet, the cloth shower curtains had old globs of shampoo on it (oh, bring your own shampoo they do not provide it), layers of dust..... I refused to take a shower all three nights I stayed here and honestly wanted to leave my dream vacation to London because the room was terrible. There is no elevator and the stairs are narrow and steep. This place is beyond a dump. There must be no building codes or Health Department inspections in London, otherwise this place would not be in existence. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: gastro_tripper
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for this accommodation (non refundable) before we started using trip advisor and were very apprehensive after reading the comments. Overall we had no problems with this stay. The position was great. 5 minutes from the Victoria train station and an easy 20 minute walk to Westminster Bridge past some great pubs. The hotel provides 24 hour front desk cover and the staff were helpful. What can you expect for 100 pound in London. The room was very basic, small but clean and some street noise. We had a room for three which was a real squeeze. The breakfast was basic but adequate. Compared to our later experience with B&Bs through the UK, this is very no frills hotel but you get what you pay for and it was all part of the adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: jeninbrighton
Reviews.Content: I stupidly tried to get the last train home to Brighton after my hen party in London one Friday night.... and of course missed it. I wandered around for about an hour, trying to find a National Express bus home, and then trying to find a hotel room for the night. The hotels around Victoria station were very expensive, most of them Â£200 - Â£300 for the night (I only needed a few hours!) Finally, a nice woman at the reception of a big hotel told me about Belgrave Road, a few blocks away from Victoria, where there are lots of little B&Bs and guest hotels. Hallelujah! I stumbled down there, and after knocking on a few doors of places that were full, I came across the Dover Hotel, which had one room left. It was Â£45 (I had no idea you could actually get a hotel room for this cheap in Central London!), and the man behind the desk was very friendly. Despite being a drunk and strangely dressed woman alone in the middle of the night, I felt quite safe right away in this hotel. My room was on the top floor, and had an en suite bathroom. The bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. I was very very impressed that I'd found somewhere this decent for Â£45 in London! I've stayed similar places in London and paid three times that much! I didn't try breakfast, as I was still dressed in my hen party costume the next morning and had to do the walk of shame out of there.... but at least I didn't have to spend the night on a park bench! I've now recommended it to my friends and family who need to stay in London on a budget - it's good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Latinos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dover for 3 nights. Excellent location, very easy to get to central and back. Definatly would stay here again and recomend to others. Dont expect 5 star, i mean it is only a bed and breakfast, and if your planning to visit all the sites in london, then all you need is somewhere to rest. Staff very friendly. Breakfast nice and simple, toast, cereal and a variety of hot and cold drinks.Toilet in our double room was very small, but we didint mind. As i said, dont expect too much, for Â£50 a night, its a bargan and your location is in Victoria, central london, that was perfect for us. Defo staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: KilgoreTroutGeorgia
Reviews.Content: After four nights in Paris, which was lovely, my wife and I took the Eurostar train to London. We had reservations booked through Expedia at the Dover. We get there and the front desk guy says we are on the third floor, and their is no elevator. Great. My wife and I heave our bags up three flights of tightly wound stairs, pouring sweat by the time we reach the top. The room was a shoebox with rotten molding around the shower, I say shower only because the toilet is in the hall, to be shared with other rooms! Now we aren't picky, but when paying over $500 for four nights, you expect your own toilet. I go back down and the guy says of course their is no refund, but we have the privledge of a room on the ground floor with our very own toilet, for an extra $200. That's right ladies and gents, north of $700 for four nights in a [--] box. Trust me, when going to London stick with chain, i.e. Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms leave a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: NickCCE
Reviews.Content: The hotel website looks a lot nicer than how the rooms actually are. We were given a quad room but the room is really too small and the bathroom with the toilet has only standing room for one person. The only good thing is that it is close to Victoria station and easily accessible which was the primary reason why we chose it. If you can afford some commute try some other hotels. The other good thing is that the room charge includes breakfast which is ok.

Reviews.Title: “good location easy to find”
Reviews.Author: kiwisahoy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice now and although the rooms are small and beds not that comfortable it is very easy to find you way around from this hotel. We would probably stay again as we are only at the hotel for sleeping/breakfast and off out again the next day. I guess anything in London that has a largeish room is more $$ attached to it - so dont expect to much and you will find it OK.

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: scoutmomsue
Reviews.Content: You know in the movies when someone is hiding out in a small hotel and the window is open and they hear all the street noise and sirens? That was pretty much like this room. It was a bed and a shower. Basically a hostel with a bathroom. The bathrooms seemed as though they were added in as an entire unit from an RV. It was small and cramped. However, the location couldn't be beat and it was cheap for London standards. I wouldn't stay there with kids, but just for us adults, it worked out nicely. You can walk to Victoria Station to get anywhere around town. We walked to Parliament, Westminster Abbey, and Buckingham Palace pretty easily. It seems to be family run and the staff was very friendly. If we asked for anything, they were on it quickly. It could definately use a renovation. The price included breakfast, but we found the breakfast area small and cramped. We found a few restaraunts close by that served a hot English breakfast for about 3 pounds.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but functional”
Reviews.Author: immaculate_itinerant
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel online at the last minute for a 3 day excursion, and it was the best deal we found at the time. Location: Excellent. Minutes' walk from Victoria train and coach stations, lots of restaurants and grocery stores in the area. When you come out of the underground at Victoria, you have to walk through the train station and up another set of escalators to exit near the coach station and Belgrave Road. There are actually tons of hotels in the area. The Dover is literally next door to the Calvados, Easy Hotel, Winchester, across the street from the Stanley, and around the corner from the Blair Victoria. The Comfort Inn and Quality Hotel Westminster are also in the area, amongst numerous others. Room: The room was actually not as horrible as we had expected. Twin room was very small. We didn't have any problems with bad smells and the room and bathroom were fairly neat and clean, although obviously old and run-down. It was by no means nice and it lacked any semblance of charm, but it was ok for a few days. Provided in the room were a small TV with 3 channels (one of which was in German); kettle with provisions for tea; alarm clock; functional hairdryer; and a small desk. The bathroom was miniscule and no toiletries were provided except for soap, but it was kept clean and mold-free. Fresh white towels were also provided. Breakfast: Breakfast was actually quite disappointing. It was vending machine coffee, self-serve cereal and juice, and white toast. The ladies in the breakfast room seemed chronically depressed but were helpful enough. Service: Front-desk service was friendly. Our room was not cleaned on the second day but fresh towels were brought up to our room immediately after we informed the front desk. Value: We felt the hotel was way overpriced for what you get, but in consideration of the extortionate hotel prices in London, this is probably true of most hotels in the city. Overall: Our stay was comfortable enough, location was fantastic, free wifi was a definite bonus, breakfast was terrible, value for money was lacking. Would recommend finding another better quality hotel online for similar price if possible. Also would recommend taking the public buses for sightseeing rather than the underground, as a daily bus pass is cheaper than a subway pass and you get to see the sights as you travel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go There”
Reviews.Author: manchester99
Reviews.Content: The room had an awful smell , the carpet up the stairs was threadbare and dangerous. The so called B&B was a bowl of cereal and 2 rounds of toast, the staff in the eating area never once acknowledged we were there . Glad we only stayed 1 night , would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “So-so...”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcLean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dover Hotel in 2006 over the 4th of July weekend. It was HOT, HOT, HOT and of course, the hotel had no air conditioning. It was fairly miserable. The rooms were TINY and the but the bed was fairly comfortable. Breakfast was good. Service was good. They allowed us to check our bags and pick them back up at the end of the day of departure so we didn't have to tote them around all day. As mentioned by others, the steps are very narrow, steep, and crooked so if you have trouble with stairs, you may want to avoid this hotel. Hotel was definitely budget - not amazing, but not horrible either. I guess it could have been worse. The location was nice - close walk to Victoria Station.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: Mushy26
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredibly small. We booked a room with a "private bath". Silly me to assume that this "private bath" would include a toilet. We had a bed, a mini shower and a sink, all in the same room. The toilet was down the hall. There were renovations going on during our entire stay. We woke up early every morning to the sound of banging and sanding. They did not even stop on weekends. Also, twice we returned to the hotel in the evening to find that housekeeping had left our door open! On a positive note, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely Our Hotel in London!!!”
Reviews.Author: pescelama
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a trip to London at one condition: finding a cheap flight and cheap accommodation. We found out about the Dover Hotel thanks to Trip Advisor: reading other travellers' reviews, it seemed to be not too bad... so we decided to try it! We booked our double room with ensuite shower one month earlier, and then we started praying: we already knew taht hotels and B&B around Victoria station in London are usually terribles, and we have to say we have a very very high clenliness standard... Well, we arrived very late in the night, just looking for a loo and a bed. What a surprise! Staff people were very friendly and helpful. The room was very small, but incredibly clean, with immaculate sheets and pillow; face and body towels were white and clean too; although the carpet, the curtains and in general the furniture were not brand new (especially the carpet on the stairs was quite old), everything was clean and well keeped. The bathroom, not bigger than a train toilet, but deeply clean, I would say shining!!! Bed was comfortable and room quiet, maybe too hot, but this is not a problem: you just have to keep the window slightly open (as we did). We got facilities in the room to make tea and coffee: I expected a stinky, crusty kettle, but it was very clean, and the cups too. We had every night a warm and nice tea in our room! The buffet breakfast consisted of a lot of warm toasts, a good choice of cold and hot beverages, cereals, butter and jam. You can eat as much as you like! The brakfast room is quite small, but this we'll give you the chance to meet other people from all over the world - we enjoyed our breakfast with 2 german guys, talking and laughing a lot!!! The hotel is 3 minutes walking to Victoria train station and 5 minutes to Victoria coach station: this means you are very close to all the strategic points to start your tour around London. With a longer walk you can easily reach interesting places like Buckingham Palace, St. James Park, Westminster Abbey. The place around is safe and quiet, even if you get back late in the night. We will definetely be back to te Dover Hotel. Of course is not the Ritz, its a cheap and simple accommodation, but it was so clean, comfortable and friendly that we decided the Dover hotel is OUR hotel in London! Some suggestion: book in adavnce, and preferably thru the website: you will save money!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: maccas37
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2005 with my wife and 18 year old son. Triple room was small but adequate. Bathroom was tiny but functional. Central heating was fine. Breakfast was included and good enough to keep you going until lunch time. Coffee was ordinary, but you can have as much cereal and toast as you want - just ask for it! We found the breakfast ladies efficient and had the tables cleaned and ready for the next guest straight away. Aussie visitors might want to bring their own vegemite!! Overall, you get what you pay for and we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for a London budget place”
Reviews.Author: dartogreen
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in this place a day before arriving and got a great internet rate. Only had to stay one night as a stopover between Belgium and Northern England, and I've got to say that for those purposes the Dover definitely did what it said on the tin. The bathroom did make me laugh out (crazy shower design), but it was still a bathroom, clean (apart from suspicious toilet seat, clean but sticky?!), magically didn't get drenched when we showered and had clean towels. The shower got warm and everything. About the room itself: It wasn't the biggest and not the smallest, not the newest but clean enough, and it had all the things it needed. Bed was okay, clean sheets, as 2 people you do definitely have to be a couple though - no space for polite distance! The television was lovely, the teamaking facilities were there - my main criticism is that they had whitening powder instead of proper milk! If you want somewhere to stay as a budget traveller in London, this place seems good enough as the location right near Victoria station is brilliant, the area seems safe and you'll probably be out all day anyway. Wouldn't recommend it for hours spent chilling in the room though. Can't comment on the breakfast as we left at 7.15.

HotelInfo.Name: The Dover Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 42-44 Belgrave Road, London SW1V 1RG, England
